column1: Table 1.1 MEAN WEEKLY HOUSING COSTS, Selected household characteristics, All households, 1994–95 to 2019–20
Mean housing costs per week in 2019–20 dollars
One parent family with dependent children
Semi-detached, row or terrace house, townhouse
Number of employed persons in household
Median amount of mortgage outstanding (in 2019–20 dollars) (i)
Mean gross household income per week (in 2019–20 dollars) (j)
Factor applied to adjust to 2019–20 dollars

Cells in this table containing 2015–16,  2017–18 and 2019–20 data have been randomly adjusted (by perturbation) to avoid the release of confidential data. Discrepancies may occur between sums of the component items and totals. See Methodology for more information
(a) Comparisons between different tenure and landlord types should be made with caution. See Methodology for more information

(e) Quintile boundaries have been calculated at the total Australia households level for consistency and comparability across tables. See Methodology for more information on equivalised disposable household income
(g) Includes households with nil or negative total income
(h) Only includes owner-occupied dwellings. Value is the self-reported estimated sale price of the dwelling. All years expressed in 2019–20 dollars, adjusted using changes in the Consumer Price Index

(i) In 2019–20 dollars, adjusted using changes in the Consumer Price Index. Only includes owners with a mortgage. From 2003–04 excludes amounts of loans for business and investment purposes secured against the dwelling

(j) In 2019–20 dollars, adjusted using changes in the Consumer Price Index. Estimates presented from 2007–08 onwards are not directly comparable with estimates for previous cycles due to the improvements made to measuring income introduced in the 2007–08 cycle. Estimates for 2003–04 and 2005–06 have been recompiled to reflect the new treatments of income, however not all new components introduced in 2007–08 are available for earlier cycles
